r.s: Provides interface to the libeio library
r.d:
This extension provides interface to the libeio library written by Marc Lehmann <libeio at schmorp dot de>(see http://software.schmorp.de/pkg/libeio.html).
Libeio is a an asynchronous I/O library. Features basically include asynchronous versions of POSIX API(read, write, open, close, stat, unlink, fdatasync, mknod, readdir etc.); sendfile (native on Solaris, Linux, HP-UX, FreeBSD); readahead. libeio itself emulates the system calls, if they are not available on specific(UNIX-like) platform.
Currently this extension supports GNU/Linux and BSD platforms only. But you can try it on any UNIX OS.
r.n: Add: BSD support Change: internal event notification uses pipe() when eventfd() is not available. Del: some redundant code Fix: use libeio's EIO_FALLOC_FL_KEEP_SIZE instead of the system constant
